definition: to have no right/to have no authority

sentences.english: The obligee's ratification of unauthorized disposition can validate the disposition behavior.
sentences.chinese: 权利人对无权处分的追认可以使处分行为有效。

sentences.english: "We don't have rights to slide over into the federal prison system, " Pustelnik said.
sentences.chinese: 我们无权直接进入联邦监狱系统。

sentences.english: It was beyond his power to sign such a contract.
Once the thief’s car passed across the state border, our state police had no jurisdiction to follow him.
sentences.chinese: 一旦窃贼的车越过州界，本州的警察便无权跟踪他。

sentences.english: Please remember our agreement. You have absolutely no right to do that.
sentences.chinese: 请你别忘了我们之间的协议，你根本无权这么做。

sentences.english: Square dancing is fundamentally an activity organized by the people. They have no right to interfere.
sentences.chinese: 广场舞基本上是民间组织的活动，他们无权干涉。

sentences.english: It was not our right to apportion power like that,” he writes.
sentences.chinese: 我们无权这样分配权力，”他在书中写道。

sentences.english: No rectification or redress is due to a player who acts on the basis of his own misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 牌手因本身误解作出的叫牌，无权提出修正或改正。

sentences.english: The university had no right to exclude the student from the examination.
sentences.chinese: 学校无权阻止这位学生参加考试。

sentences.english: You have no right to tamper with others' affairs.
sentences.chinese: 你无权干涉别人的事情。

sentences.english: Delos's representatives are not entitled to collect monies due unless they are explicitly authorized to do so.
sentences.chinese: 在未经授权的情况下，道尔的代表无权收集应付款项。

sentences.english: Since Modern Liberation Movement, freedom of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 我们无权干涉她的婚姻自由。

sentences.english: No party who has signed the contract has the rught to break if.
sentences.chinese: 签署合同的任何一方都无权撕毁合同。

sentences.english: And no man shall have power to do any thing against them, or to molest any of them, in any cause.
sentences.chinese: 为一切事件，谁也无权干涉及骚扰他们中任何一人。

sentences.english: But he doesn't even have a right to say.
sentences.chinese: 可即使他现在也无权过问。

sentences.english: You have no right to seek into my life without just cause.
sentences.chinese: 没有正当理由你无权过问我的生活。

definition: to have the right to/to be entitled to/to have authority/powerful
right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
to have the final say/to be the one in charge
